intro: Tanacetum ornatum, commonly known as the white tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white composite flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and disturbed areas. Tanacetum ornatum is known for its aromatic foliage and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
